text: The arrondissement of Avallon is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Yonne département in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region. Its capital is the city of Avallon. ==History== When the Yonne department was created on 17 February 1800, the arrondissement of Avallon was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Avallon is bordered to the north by the Aube (Champagne-Ardenne) department, to the east by the Côte-d'Or (Burgundy) department, to the south by the Nièvre (Burgundy) department and to the west by the arrondissement of Auxerre. It is the easternmost arrondissement of the department, with an area of . It has 47,594 inhabitants, the arrondissement of the department with fewer people living there, and a population density of inhabitants/km². ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Avallon, there are three cantons where not all their "communes" are in the arrondissement. The following table shows the distribution of the "communes" in the cantons and arrondissements: Cantons and communes in the arrondissement of Avallon INSEE Code Canton Arrondissements Total Auxerre Avallon Senes 8905 Avallon 27 27 8907 Chablis 23 39 62 8912 Joux-la-Ville 21 23 44 8915 Saint-Florentin 14 8 22 8919 Tonnerrois 52 52 ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Avallon has 139 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): #
